name: Novotel Ningaloo Resort

reviews.title: Lovely accomodation
reviews.text: We spent 3 days of our honeymoon at Novotel Ningaloo Resort.
The staff were friendly and obliging, the pool inviting and the view gorgeous.
reviews.title: Nice but pricy!

reviews.text: Fantastic room with 2 person spa, balcony and room to breathe.
reviews.title: Room for Improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food in the restaurant is very nice and room service equally delicious.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The town itself is standard military/mining temporary village chic, but the attraction is the reef.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Right on a lovely sandy beach with a very warm pool. We were offered upgrade to an ocean view room but the standard room we booked was more than adequate. It was large and luxurious with fluffy Towels and slippers, fridge and enough equipment for breakfast.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.text: We ate in the restaurant on our first evening but service was very slow, there was no draught beer available as all pumps out of action but food was good. We would go back and recommend.
reviews.title: Great reception staff

reviews.text: Trip was made more enjoyable by the local knowledge and travel advice given by the friendly reception staff, including a "trainee" whose professionalism would put many "experts" to shame.
reviews.title: best place to stay in Exmouth

reviews.text: They also intervened with the rental car company (which we had booked independently from Melbourne) to ensure that our unroadworthy tyres were replaced, thus ensuring peace of mind for our onward journey to Perth.
reviews.title: Complete rip off, disappointing and absolutely not worth what you pay for

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Only criticism of the hotel is that the clarity of the pool water was somewhat less than ours at home and indeed at most hotels we've experienced.
reviews.title: Beautiful place

reviews.text: Large rooms in modern resort with excellent service from all the team. We stayed in a two room upper floor suite (508) which had lovely views across the bay and was far enough away from restaurant area to be nice and quiet.
reviews.title: Good resort with excellent service

reviews.text: Pool area large and little used during the day (everybody's away on tours) but we never saw it full.
reviews.title: Really pleasant buildings and location. Food and Internet horrible.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Food was very good - barramundi some of the best we've tasted and the mussels with lemongrass, chilli, coconut and kaffir lime - wonderful.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel
Stylish resort in an awesome location
reviews.text: All the staff were extremely helpful but a special mention for Sarah who steered us in the perfect choice of room and helped us in making a decision on an outstanding whale shark tour - thank you, you were great.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We enjoyed it so much we booked to come back in 2014.
reviews.title: Breakaway 3 night stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a relatively new hotel on the outskirts of the town, with good facilities - restaurant, bar, swimming pool, free wifi in the main building, etc . The staff were extremely friendly, helpful and efficient. The rooms were clean and cool but we couldn't get the air conditioning to maintain an even temperature - it was either permanently cooling, or off!
reviews.title: New clean hotel good facilities and great staff

reviews.text: Beach towels were provided, and slippers, but despite the pool, there were no robes available. Laundry facilities were present in every block (4 rooms) at no cost except for washing powder.
reviews.title: Luxury in Exmouth

reviews.text: A good choice if you are staying in the area, both for its facilities and as a base to tour around.
reviews.title: Nice resort well positioned on the coast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a great small hotel. All the staff are superb in every aspect. It was quiet and I slept well - this was important as I'm very noise sensative. The room was fantastic.
reviews.title: Poor Quality food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at Mantra's - the in-house restaurant - is good enough and I particularly enjoyed the vegetarian pakoras, the tandoori chicken salad and the wagyu burger. These were bargains compared to the more chefy mains which, strangely enough, I found little less tasty. Breakfast was kinda uninspiring - the usual bain-maries that cause the food to sweat and the scambled egg to congeal into a solid mass. I think eggs made-to-order (which is available anyway) should replace the scambled congealment. This would serve a hotel of such obvious refinement as this far better.
reviews.title: Didn't live up to expectations

description: Novotel Ningaloo Resort is located on Sunrise Beach, part of Exmouth's new marina development. The resort features a choice of one, two and three bedroom apartments and bungalows, a restaurant, bar, swimming pool, gymnasium and conference facilities. Ningaloo Reef is Australia's largest fringing coral reef and is a protected marine park. It is also one of the few reefs that can be accessed straight from the beach.
